greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) is the number of s in {1,...,n}^n having longest contiguous subsequence with the same value of length k; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} k * T(n,k) = A228194(n). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 23 2020
maple: T:= proc(n) option remember; local b; b:=
proc(m, s, i) option remember; `if`(m>i or s>m, 0,
mathematica: T[n_] := T[n] = Module[{b}, b[m_, s_, i_] := b[m, s, i] = If[m>i || s>m, 0, If[i == 1, n, If[s == 1, (n-1)*Sum[b[m, h, i-1], {h, 1, m}], b[m, s-1, i-1] + If[s == m, b[m-1, s-1, i-1], 0]]]]; Table[Sum[b[k, s, n], {s, 1, k}], {k, 1, n}]]; Table[ T[n], {n, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 06 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Walt Rorie-Baety_, Aug 15 2013
